articles.title: Greetings to Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian President
Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of Algeria, on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the start of the Algerian revolution.
					 The message affirmed the DPRK's invariable support to the struggle of the president and the government of Algeria for consolidating the political stability and achieving the economic development of the country and sincerely wished him good health and happiness and the friendly Algerian people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Algerian PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian PM
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju on Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Abdel Malik Sellal, prime minister of Algeria, on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the start of the Algerian revolution.
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with the common interests of the peoples of the two countries and wished the prime minister success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho sent a similar message to Ramtane Lamamra, minister of State and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Algeria, on the same day.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Ri Su Yong, member of the Political Bureau and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), came back home Tuesday after taking part in the 18th international meeting of communist parties and workers' parties held in Vietnam.

articles.title: SPA Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
SPA Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) led by Deputy Ri Jong Hyok, director of the National Reunification Institute, came back home Tuesday after taking part in the 135th Conference of the Inter-Parliamentary Union held in Geneva.

articles.title: Japanese Buddhist Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Buddhist Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A Japanese Buddhist delegation with Raitei Arima, director general of the Kyoto Buddhist Society of Japan, as its honorary leader and Imei Miyamoto, representation officer of Head Temple, Shohin-ji, as its leader, left here for home Tuesday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Embassy Officials Do Friendship Labor
articles.content:
Vietnamese Embassy Officials Do Friendship Labor
Sariwon, November 1 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese Ambassador to the DPRK Pham Viet Hung and staff members of his embassy did friendship labor at the DPRK-Vietnam Friendship Migok Cooperative Farm in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province Tuesday.
					 The guests visited the Migok Revolutionary Museum and looked round historical relics displayed there, being briefed on the leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the farm. 
					
					 They helped farmers in threshing beans.
					
					 They handed over aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: National Exhibition of Forest Machines Held
articles.content:
National Exhibition of Forest Machines Held
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of forest machines was held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House from Oct. 30 to Nov. 1.
					 Present there were units of forest machine research and manufacture including the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection and the Ministry of Forestry.
					
					 Presented there were at least 160 forest machines, equipment and tools of over 30 kinds.
					
					 There took place experts and mass examinations of forest machines and equipment including nursery, seed, afforestation and protection machines and tools.
					
					 Efficient machines drew attention of the participants.
					
					 South Phyongan Province took the first place at the exhibition.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Jik University of Education in DPRK
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Jik University of Education in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jik University of Education in the DPRK greeted the 70th anniversary of its birth.
					 It was founded under the deep care of President Kim Il Sung just after Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 The university had since developed into a reliable center for production of teachers, under the loving care of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, and made a big contribution to turning the country into a education powerhouse.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un saw to it that the buildings Nos. 2 and 3 and a library of the university were built on a modern basis to suit the demands of the new century.
					
					 Over the past decades, the university has produced 14 winners of the Kim Il Sung Prize, 20-odd winners of the titles of DPRK Hero and Labor Hero, scores of People's Teacher Title holders and many other veteran educators, scientists, artistes, actors and actresses and athletes.
					
					 The university has also played a significant role in the work to improve the qualifications of teachers and make all the people well versed in science and technology by ensuring the service of data on education science and the tele-education on a nationwide scale.
					
					 Meanwhile, it made admirable achievements in working out textbooks, reference books and e-teaching programs and developing various kinds of computer programs on education.
					
					 In recent years alone, the university put more than 150 classrooms on a multi-functional basis and built a refectory and a swimming pool with a total floor space of thousands of square meters.
					
					 At present, the university strives to perfect its educational system and turn itself into a pedigree establishment of normal education, a centre for the study of educational science and a base for international academic exchange.

articles.title: Results of Housing Construction in Disaster Areas of DPRK
articles.content:
Results of Housing Construction in Disaster Areas of DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The housing construction is progressing apace at the final stage in Yonsa County, one of the flood-hit areas in northern part of the DPRK.
					 In Saji district of the township and Namjak-ri of the county, soldier-builders finished in three days the roof covering for 16 apartment houses for more than 500 families. They are now speeding up the ceiling plastering, fixing doors and electric and other works.
					
					 In Kuso district of the township and several villages, shock brigade members from different parts of the country have already completed or conducted at the final stage the construction of more than 1,100 flats.

articles.title: Pyongyang Catfish Farm
articles.content:
Pyongyang Catfish Farm
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Catfish Farm in the DPRK has directed big efforts to further improving its material and technical foundation for pisciculture.
					 The farm completed a bulking food production process and established a system of adjusting water temperature for the production of fries.
					
					 Its technicians settled a lot of technical problems and made tens of technical inventions to normalize the production on a high level.
					
					 In October last year, supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited this farm and indicated the tasks facing it. He called upon it to produce 2,000 tons of catfish in a year and apply advanced technology so as to reduce the fish food consumption unit and the production cost as much as possible in a short period.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Praises Feats Kim Jong Il Performed in Leading Socialist Cause to Victory
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Praises Feats Kim Jong Il Performed in Leading Socialist Cause to Victory
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an editorial praises leader Kim Jong Il as an outstanding leader and peerless political elder who led the socialist cause of Juche to victory.
					 His history of revolutionary leadership is shining as the sacred one in which he wisely led the Korean revolution with intense loyalty, faith in sure victory and iron will to accomplish the socialist cause, it says, adding:
					
					 He conducted energetic ideological and theoretical activities to glorify the socialist ideology and theory as a scientific and revolutionary banner of victory in which the people-first doctrine is thoroughly embodied.
					
					Thanks to him, ideas and theories including the Juche-oriented viewpoint on the position and role of human beings and the socio-historical principle centred on the popular masses were newly formulated and Korean-style socialism could demonstrate its might as invincible socialism based on the popular masses.
					
					 When the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces were directing the spearhead of attack to the DPRK, he steered the Korean revolution on the forefront of defending socialism under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 Thanks to the right course of charge and that of devoted service indicated by Kim Jong Il through endless journeys made to forefront posts for defending the country, the Korean People's Army could grow to be a matchless army and our national defense industry develop into a self-reliant defense industry capable of successfully producing any latest military hardware it desired and the country turned into an invulnerable fortress which no imperialist force dared attack.
					
					 He visited at least 14 290 units across the country all his life for building a powerful socialist country, making forced marches by covering 669 844 km, the distance equivalent to going round the earth nearly 17 times. 
					
					 Under his unremitting and energetic leadership, the road of advance for prosperity was ushered in on the land of the country and the Korean people enjoyed all sorts of honor that they could not do in the national history spanning thousands of years. 
					
					 He perfectly solved the issue of succession to the leadership, the fundamental issue of accomplishing the socialist cause. This was the greatest feat he performed before the country and the nation, the era and the history.

articles.title: Socialism Advances along Orbit of Victory: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Socialism Advances along Orbit of Victory: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates an article to the 22nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il' work "Socialism Is a Science".
					 The work published on Nov. 1, Juche 82 (1994) proves the scientific truth, accuracy, advantages and inevitability of victory of socialism.
					
					 Socialism the "end" of which was declared by the imperialists at the end of the Cold War has dynamically advanced along the orbit of victory while strikingly demonstrating the advantages and invincibility of socialism, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding ideological and theoretical wisdom of Kim Jong Il, socialism which could have been branded as a fictitious utopia and non science could show its true picture before the world as a science despite all obstructions and advance, unperturbed, along the road of victory.
					
					 Over the past 22 years, the might of truth inherent in the work published by Kim Jong Il was fully demonstrated.
					
					 Humankind found their way in the great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 Associations, societies and groups for the study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Songun politics and the Juche idea were organized in various countries to widely disseminate the idea of independence and the genuine socialist idea.
					
					 The reality in our country where the politics of prioritizing, respecting and loving the people was enforced helped the progressives of the world have clear understanding of socialism from a fresh angle.
					
					 The world progressives are waging a dynamic struggle for the victory of socialism worldwide after adopting the above-said work as an action program, unanimously hailing it as the banner which they should invariably hold fast to.

articles.title: Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Make Switchover in Its Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Urges U.S. to Make Switchover in Its Policy towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Many media and experts of the world often comment that the U.S. has completely failed in its attempt to prevent the DPRK from having access to nukes and it is racking its brains over what relations it should have with the DPRK which has dramatically improved its strategic position.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says that as world public comments, the DPRK has accomplished its historic cause of ranking itself among the nuclear weapons states by successfully frustrating the U.S. harsh economic sanctions against the DPRK and the U.S. strategy of isolating and stifling it.
					
					 It is needless to say that the key to this miracle is that the DPRK has consistently adhered to the line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of the nuclear force.
					
					 Now that the line has proved to be the most just one to safeguard the sovereignty of the country and the peace and security of the region, the DPRK will continue to keep to the road chosen by itself no matter what others may say.
					
					 The U.S. has no strength to bar the strategic position and national power of the DPRK from increasing day by day.
					
					 The U.S. has been placed in a dilemma in dealing with the issue of the DPRK-U.S. ties and its position is getting poor as the days go by. This is attributable to its ignorance of its rival and self-complacency.
					
					 The U.S. has behaved arrogantly holding cheap the DPRK, a dignified nuclear giant. Herein lies the U.S. mistake in the policy.
					
					 The U.S. self-assurance and the consciousness of its supremacy will bring it to its self-ruin.
					
					 The U.S. had better learn before anything else to respect the DPRK, its rival.
					
					 It would be well advised to abandon its failed policy towards the DPRK and make a switchover in it. This is the only way to escape its fate of ruin.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces' Sanctions against DPRK Only Lead to Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Puppet Forces' Sanctions against DPRK Only Lead to Self-destruction: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces' reckless sanctions against the DPRK lead to self-destruction as they only precipitate their final ruin, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 The U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group have become frantic in their racket for sanctions, disclosing their sinister scheme to stifle the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 They seem to calculate that if they escalate their sanctions and pressure on the DPRK to the maximum, they will finally force it to raise its hands up or "collapse" itself. It is foolhardy for them to pin their hope on "sanctions-all-mighty doctrine".
					
					 Much upset by the DPRK's strategic position in which it has passed the final gateway to rounding off the state nuclear force, the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors are crying out for slapping "toughest sanctions" against the DPRK but it would get them nowhere.
					
					 Despite their persistent and harsh sanctions, the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a nuclear power in the East possessed of even H-bomb, and a space power.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. and the Park group may work, the DPRK will advance toward the final victory at faster speed and with redoubled dynamism on the self-development principle and based on the single-minded unity of the army and people as it has everything in place and had access to the strongest nuclear deterrent. 
					
					 The U.S. and the puppet forces had better bear in mind that such ridiculous racket of ratcheting up sanctions and pressure would only result in precipitating their final miserable doom.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye Group's "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams Park Geun Hye Group's "Human Rights" Racket against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Driven into a tight corner by their unprecedented ruling crisis, the Park Geun Hye group of south Korea are acting like a drowning man catching at a straw.
					 Recently, the puppet forces staged a ground-breaking ceremony for "June 25 War Defectors' Memorial" and the farce called "international film festival on human rights in the north".
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary brands this as a foolish act to downplay the daily growing strategic position of the DPRK and tarnish its dignified image and prevent the cooperation in pressurizing it from sinking.
					
					 The above-sad burlesque is aimed to groundlessly label the DPRK an abductor and to escalate international "human rights" racket against the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Finding themselves in the abyss of ruin due to unprecedented scandals including the case of Choe Sun Sil's monopoly of state administration, the Park group orchestrated such ruckuses in a bid to divert elsewhere the attention of the public focused on them and prolong their remaining days.
					
					 Being keen on plots and fabrications, the puppet forces have frantic in their provocations against the DPRK. But they can never cover up their sinister intention lurking behind them.
					
					 What the puppet forces are concerned about is not the human rights issue. Their ulterior aims are to collude and conspire with outsiders and hurt and stifle the fellow countrymen under the signboard of "human rights". What they really seek through the above-said charades is to escalate the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket and put spurs to the cooperation in international pressure by escalating the smear campaign against the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 The Park group had better bear in mind that their madcap racket for confrontation would only precipitate their doomsday.

articles.title: U.S. Termed Biggest Prison, Torture and Murder State
articles.content:
U.S. Termed Biggest Prison, Torture and Murder State 
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The true nature of the U.S. as the world's worst human rights tundra has been brought to bolder relief recently.
					 La Juventud, organ of the March 26 Movement of Uruguay, carried a photo-accompanied article recently which said that 24,000 prisoners in 50 prisons in 12 U.S. states staged mass protest for 40 days against the police barbarous actions.
					
					 U.S. Website VOX said that the protests were attributable to the barbarous acts of police and labor conditions of "modern version of slavery" which was enforced at national, federal state and private prisons.
					
					 Prisoners in different parts of the U.S. staged protests all at once on the 45th anniversary of the killing of prisoners in Attica Prison, New York, a clear indication of the serious human rights abuses in the U.S. prisons.
					
					 As known, there was a riot of prisoners in the prison on Sept. 9, 1971 against the inhumane treatment.
					
					 More than 1,000 protesters waged a fierce struggle for four days, being armed with clubs and iron tube.
					
					 They punished executioners and threw into prison warders and demanded immediate release of all political prisoners.
					
					 Much upset by this, the then Nixon group sent hundreds of military police to put down the protesters in the course of which 33 prisoners were killed.
					
					 This time, too, the prison warders armed with small arms and tear gas guns encircled protesters and threatened them and committed such inhuman act of coercively feeding the prisoners who were on a hunger strike.
					
					 Now in U.S. there are more than 2.2 million prisoners.
					
					 According to internet newspaper Global Post, the U.S. which accounts for just 5 percent of the world population holds 25 percent of the total number of prisoners worldwide.
					
					 Clint Smith, post-graduate student of Harvard University, said that lots of people are being put behind bars on charges of involvement in widespread socio-political cases.
					
					 Human rights abuses in prisons baffle human imagination.
					
					 Torture has been adopted as a policy in the U.S. and not only methods used during the medieval era but means aided with modern science and technology are being used to torture prisoners in the severest manner.
					
					 CIA spent tens of millions of U.S. dollars to invent new torture techniques and methods.
					
					 They include making prisoners stand for 180 hours, letting them maintain stressed posture, not allowing them to sleep with their hand-cuffed hands held up, ice bath torture, torture by letting them lie in coffin, letting them eat and sleep in water, putting insects into a small box where a prisoner is kept, forced feeding, electric torture and sexual torture.
					
					 No wonder, delegates from more than 110 countries to an international meeting in May last year exposed human rights abuses committed in the U.S. and tendered at least 350 recommendations to the U.S. authorities on putting right the inhuman and unethical human rights performances. 
					
					 The horrible human rights situation in the U.S. finds its vivid manifestation in the ceaseless gun-related crimes.
					
					 Against the backdrop of rapid increase in murder of black people by police, there was a barbarous shooting of a Ugandan man called Alfred Olango by police in California, U.S. toward the end of September.
					
					 The American police shot five bullets at defenseless Alfred, mercilessly killing him.
					
					 The police made excuses that he thought the man was taking out a gun but, in fact, he had no gun.
					
					 The victim was the 217th black man who met grievous death by the U.S. police this year.
					
					 The Ugandan ambassador to the U.S. lodged an official protest with the U.S. government and demanded earlier probe into the truth.
					
					 Gun-related crimes have become an incurable "malignant epidemic" in the U.S.
					
					 Two university students were killed on the campus in North Carolina State University on October 2 in October and on 3rd there were two shooting sprees in Minneapolis, Minnesota, which left six injured.
					
					 Shooting sprees on the 15th and 18th caused several casualties in Los Angeles and San Francisco.
					
					 Gun reports are heard at any time in different parts like campus, streets, apartment buildings, shops, parks, hospitals, public places and even entertainment halls.
					
					 The number of arms possessed by citizens numbers about 300 million and more than 30,000 are killed and at least 200,000 are injured due to arms every year.
					
					 Commenting on the severity of the gun-related crimes in the U.S., its publication said it is deplorable that Americans are spending each day with easiness and horror amid the medieval darkness.  
					
					 Hard to find in the world is such country as the U.S. where the right to existence and security of people are not guaranteed and even elementary human rights are wantonly violated. 
					
					 It is shameless for the U.S. to style itself "human rights judge" while trumpeting about "human rights issue" of someone.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the international community denounces the U.S. as the "patent" area of human rights of the U.S. and the world's biggest human rights abuser.
					
					 The U.S. had better mind its own business before talking about "human rights issue" of others.
					
					 It is the unanimous demand of the international community that it is imperative to bring the U.S. to the human rights tribunal and mete out stern punishment to it.
					
					 History will certainly force the U.S. to pay for the worst human rights abuses.

articles.title: Ban Ki-moon's anti-DPRK Reckless Remarks Censured
articles.content:
Ban Ki-moon's anti-DPRK Reckless Remarks Censured
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Despite the warnings of the DPRK, Ban Ki-moon has not stopped hurling mud at the DPRK.
					 On Oct. 21 he took issue with the DPRK over its measures to bolster up its nuclear force at an official meeting and made no scruple of crying out for quickly adopting a "UN resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK. He went the lengths of letting out a whole string of vituperation that "serious human rights abuses are unabated" and "the north's human rights issue should be discussed by the international community."
					
					 Even today when he is to lose the job as UN chief, he is taking the lead in the campaign to "impose sanctions on the north" and pull up it over "its human rights issues". His behavior is prompted by the sinister intention to curry favor with the U.S. and Park Geun Hye in an attempt to become south Korean puppet president even by hurting the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 He is a wicked stooge of the U.S. who is hated by the south Korean people as proven by his disgusting behavior.
					
					 He has gone reckless in his sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north since he sought a job as a politician, clinging to the coattail of the U.S.
					
					 When holding the post of puppet minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade, he deteriorated the north-south relations, pursuant to Bush's theory of "forcing the DPRK to scrap its nuclear program first", and cried out for dispatching south Korean troops to Iraq at the beck and call of the U.S.
					
					 He was censured as "American diplomat" for his pro- U.S. diplomacy.
					
					 After becoming UN secretary general under the wire-pulling of his American master, he has abused the international arena as a platform for confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, zealously backing the U.S. and Park's racket to impose sanctions on the DPRK and their smear campaign.
					
					 No wonder, over the last decade of his office as UN secretary general the world body has turned into the most corrupt and inefficient international organization which allowed the high-handed and arbitrary practices of the U.S. and its vassal forces and legalized invasion of weak small countries and injustice.
					
					 It is great shame on the nation that such traitor as Ban is allowed to go frantic in the international arena with worship of the U.S. and submission to it and confrontation with compatriots, instead of doing even a single thing for the fellow countrymen and the nation.
					
					 Ban is sadly mistaken if he calculates he can easily become "president" if he wins Park's favor with the backing of the U.S.
					
					 It is the reality of south Korea that the south Korean people from all walks of life are chanting slogans "Judge Park Geun Hye!" " Impeach Park Geun Hye!" and closest confidants of Chongwadae and the "Saenuri Party" are jumping from the sinking "Park Geun Hye boat" one after another to survive. 
					
					 The south Korean people have already sentenced him to death as he is making desperate efforts to take over power from Park on deathbed whose support rate is rapidly sinking.
					
					 He would be well advised to bear in mind that he would not be able to return to south Korea as an ordinary man, to say nothing of seeking presidency.
					
					 Even country dogs will not welcome Pan.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage Joint Landing Drill against DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces to Stage Joint Landing Drill against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet army announced that it would stage a joint landing drill in the East Sea of Korea and the area of Phohang, North Kyongsang Province from October 31 to November 6. The joint rehearsal is aimed at bolstering up the capability of the puppet army for independently carrying out landing operations. 
					 To be involved in the drill are more than 10 warships including Aegis destroyer, landing craft, mine clearing craft, war planes of the ground, naval and air forces and at least 30 armored cars, thousands troops of the marine corps and even civilian ships.
					
					 U.S. marines will reportedly join in the drill to get familiar with the procedures of joint landing operations with the puppet army. 
					
					 Chungmu drill will reportedly kick off in Ulsan and South Kyongsang Province, timed to coincide with the joint landing drill.

articles.title: Bus-Demo Staged in S. Korea Demands Resignation of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Bus-Demo Staged in S. Korea Demands Resignation of Park Geun Hye
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Trade unionists under the bus-branch in North Jolla Province of the Public Transport and Service Trade Union in south Korea launched bus-demonstration in demand of the resignation of Park Geun Hye on Oct. 28, according to the south Korean online paper Voice of People.
					 By inheriting the tradition of the June popular resistance in 1987, more than 300 buses sounded warning whistles all at once and started operation with slogan "Step down Park Geun Hye" attached to their front.

articles.title: S. Korean Broadcasting Denounces Puppet Group for Failing to Probe Truth behind Administration Monopoly
articles.content:
S. Korean Broadcasting Denounces Puppet Group for Failing to Probe Truth behind Administration Monopoly
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean KBS denounced the puppet group for failing to probe the truth behind the incident of administration monopoly while turning a deaf ear to the voices of the people.
					 It said that the campaign of the declaration on the situation calling for probing the truth behind the incident is gaining in scope and strength and it represented the people's anger and despair.
					
					 The prosecution is making slow progress in the compliant of the incident. And it did not seize nor investigate but only summoned the witness for the mere form's sake.

articles.title: U.S. Paper on Shaman Controlling "President" and Society
articles.content:
U.S. Paper on Shaman Controlling "President" and Society
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. paper New York Times on Oct. 28 carried an article which said a shaman controlled the "president" and the society in south Korea, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The paper ridiculed that shaman named Choe Sun Sil revised major addresses of Park Geun Hye and supervised even her dress, exercising strong influence on her, adding there existed the "adviser in darkness" behind the Park's regime.

articles.title: Korean Book, Stamp and Handicraft Exhibition Opens in Russia
articles.content:
Korean Book, Stamp and Handicraft Exhibition Opens in Russia
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, stamp and handicraft exhibition was opened with due ceremony on Oct. 27 at an art gallery in Moscow Region on the 90th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 Hanging on the front wall of the venue was a picture of leader Kim Jong Il meeting with President Putin. 
					
					 On display there were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books, stamps and handicraft works introducing the proud reality of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants in the opening ceremony laid bouquets before the picture of Kim Jong Il meeting with Putin and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK's Holidays Marked in Nepal, Mongolia
articles.content:
DPRK's Holidays Marked in Nepal, Mongolia
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Nepali and Mongolian newspapers and internet websites carried special news on the 19th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and its 71st founding anniversary and the 90th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					 The Nepali newspaper Arpan on Oct. 7 carried several articles together with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 In an article titled "Invincible WPK" it said the WPK is the party guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism the core of which is the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 The article titled "We serve the people!" said the WPK has it as its iron rule to solve all the problems by prioritizing the demand and interests of the people all the times. Chairman of the WPK Kim Jong Un is devoting his all to the work for the people true to the intention of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Nepal Journalist Association and the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics posted on their websites similar articles on the same day.
					
					 The Montsame on Oct. 4 posted on its internet homepage an article praising Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un for building and developing the WPK, illustrated with photos showing the might of the single-minded unity of the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Academic Figure on Nukes in DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Academic Figure on Nukes in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 1 (KCNA) -- Anastasia Olegovna Barannikova, academic secretary of the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia in the Far East Region of Russia, recently made public an essay "Is the DPRK's nuclear program really dangerous?"
					 Referring to the successful test of H-bomb, nuclear warhead explosion test, test-fire of surface to surface medium- and long-range strategic rocket Hwasong-10, test-fire of SLBM, etc., the author went on:
					
					 It is necessary to disclose the real intention of sophism made by the U.S. and the West in order to be aware of whether the nuclear weapons of the DPRK constitute "threat" or not.
					
					1. "Nuclear tests of the DPRK damage ecological environment of surrounding countries."
					
					The survey results by experts in the Far East region of Russia and neighboring counties of China show the contrary results.
					
					The nuclear tests of the DPRK did not have any bad impact on ecological environment of surrounding areas.
					
					 2. "DPRK is going to attack U.S., Japan and south Korea."
					
					This is based on the "assertion" of the U.S. and its followers who are repeating stereo-typed rhetoric.
					
					It is none other than the "democracy"-advocating U.S. which used first the nuclear weapon against other country.
					
					 The reality in the DPRK is contrary to that touted by the U.S. and the West.
					
					3. "Nuclear tests of the DPRK will seriously damage its neighboring  countries as their blast intensity is tremendous."
					
					   This was out of ignorance of the reality of the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK is making economic development and it stays ahead of the world in the latest technology.
					
					   It has excellent nuclear experts with rich knowledge and technology. 
					
					   That is why the probability of destructive crisis is zero.
					
					The author stressed that now the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK made its nuclear position stronger and the nukes of the DPRK are not dangerous as compared with those of the nuclear powers.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita 62o aniversario de inicio de revolucion argelina
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita 62o aniversario de inicio de revolucion argelina
Pyongyang, primero de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia primero un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Argelina Democratica y Popular, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, con motivo del 62o aniversario del inicio de la Revolucion Argelina.
					Afirmando el invariable apoyo de la RPDC a los esfuerzos del mandatario y el gobierno argelinos por consolidar la estabilidad politica del pais y lograr el desarrollo economico, el remitente deseo al destinatario buena salud y felicidad y al amistoso pueblo argelino, el progreso y la prosperidad.

articles.title: Regresa delegacion de PTC
articles.content:
EE.UU. es el Estado carcelario, torturador y asesino, comenta ACNC
Pyongyang, primero de noviembre (ACNC) -- Se hace cada vez mas evidente la fachada de EE.UU., peor violador de DDHH del mundo.
					 Recientemente, La Juventud, organo del Movimiento "26 de Marzo" de Uruguay, reporto con fotos las protestas masivas de mas de 40 dias contra la represion barbara de la policia que tuvieron lugar en medio centenar de reclusorios en 12 estados norteamericanos con la participacion de 24 mil reos.
					
					 El sitio Web de EE.UU. VOX transmitio que la causa principal de esas protestas estuvo en las barbaries de la policia y las condiciones laborales calificadas de "esclavitud de cuno moderno" en las carceles estatales, estaduales y privadas.
					
					  Esta lucha simultanea comenzo con motivo del 45o aniversario del asesinato masivo de los encarcelados de la Prision Attica de Nueva York.
					
					  El 9 de septiembre de 1971, mas de un millar de prisioneros armados con palos y tubos de hierro se rebelaron contra las vejaciones inhumanitarias.
					
					  Durante 4 dias, ellos castigaron a los verdugos, pusieron en cautiverio a los carceleros y demandaron la liberacion inmediata de todos los presos politicos.
					
					  La camarilla de Nixon movilizo a cientos de policias militares en la operacion antimotin que dejo como saldo 33 reos asesinados.
					
					  Actualmente, permanecen tras las rejas mas de 2 millones 200 mil estadounidenses a lo largo de EE.UU.
					
					  De acuerdo con el periodico online Global Post, los encerrados en EE.UU. constituyen un cuarto de la poblacion encarcelada en todo el mundo aunque la poblacion de ese pais ocupa solo el 5 % de la mundial.
					
					  En opinion de Clint Smith, estudiante de postgraduado de la Universidad Harvard, numerosas personas se encarcelan por casos sociopoliticos mas amplios.
					
					  En EE.UU., donde la tortura es una politica, se tortura a los recluidos con metodos medievales abusando hasta de los medios cientifico-tecnicos modernos.
					
					  La CIA invierte decenas de millones de US$ en la invencion de nuevas tecnologias y crueles metodos de tortura.
					
					  En una reunion internacional celebrada en mayo del ano pasado, los delegados de mas de 110 paises condenaron mordazmente las practicas de violacion de DDHH en EE.UU. y presentaron a las autoridades de este pais la mocion de casi 350 puntos para la reparacion de la inhumanitaria y antietica situacion de DDHH.
					
					  Por otra parte, se reportan sin parar en ese pais los crimenes asociados con el uso de armas de fuego.
					
					  A medida que crecen bruscamente los casos de asesinato de negros por la policia, ocurrio a finales de septiembre en el Estado de California el tiroteo indiscriminado de la policia contra el ugandes identificado Alfred Olango, la 217a victima de este tipo del ano en curso.
					
					  El embajador ugandes en EE.UU. protesto oficialmente al gobierno norteamericano demandando la averiguacion pronta del incidente.
					
					En la sociedad estadounidense los crimenes con armas se hacen una "epidemia" incurable. 
					
					Se cometen por doquier los horribles incidentes de homicidio con armas. 
					
					A citar por ejemplo, el 2 de octubre pasado, quedaron muertos los dos estudiantes en el recinto de la Universidad Provincial de North Carolina, y el dia siguiente, ocurrieron los dos crimenes con armas en la ciudad de Miniapolis del Estado de Minnesota dejando como saldo 6 lesionados. 
					
					Y los dias 15 y 18, los otros casos semejantes ocurridos sucesivamente en Los Angeles del Estado de California y en San Francisco quitaron la vida de varias personas. 
					
					Se oyen a menudo los disparos de homicidio por doquier del pais incluso las escuelas, calles, apartamentos, tiendas, parques, hospitales, establecimientos publicos y hasta en los casinos e iglesias. 
					
					El numero de armas que tienen los moradores estadounidenses alcanza a 300 millones, aproximadamente. Y cada ano resultan muertas mas de 30 mil personas y lesionadas mas de 200 mil en los crimenes de armas. 
					
					Al respecto, una publicacion estadounidense transmitio que "es lamentable que los estadounidenses maten entre si y pasen los dias con inquietud y panico en la oscuridad medieval".
					
					En este planeta no hay otro pais como EE.UU. donde no se garantizan la subsistencia y la seguridad del hombre y se ven pisoteados despiadadamente hasta los derechos elementales de los seres humanos. 
					
					El reino criminal e infierno humano, esto es la realidad de la sociedad estadounidense. 
					
					Es muy cinico que este caudillo de crimenes anti-DDHH actue como "juez de DDHH" cuestionando la situacion de "derechos humanos" de otros paises. 
					
					Por esta razon, la sociedad internacional opina que la violacion de derechos humanos es el "privilegio" de EE.UU., pais de extermino de DDHH sin igual en el mundo. 
					
					EE.UU. debe atender primero la situacion de DDHH de su propio pais antes de hablar del "problema de DDHH" de otros. 
					
					La sociedad internacional exige unanimemente a someter al imperio americano al banquillo de acusado del tribunal de derechos humanos y sentenciarle el castigo duro. 
					
					La historia saldara la cuenta estricta de los crimenes de EE.UU., archi-violador de DDHH.

articles.title: Ban Ki-moon es sirviente politico desagradable para la nacion coreana
articles.content:
Ban Ki-moon es sirviente politico desagradable para la nacion coreana
Pyongyang, primero de noviembre (ACNC) -- A pesar de nuestra advertencia, Ban Ki-moon sigue acusando a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El 21 de octubre pasado, el volvio a ofender en un lugar publico las medidas tomadas por la RPDC para fortalecer las fuerzas armadas nucleares insistiendo en la aprobacion pronta de la "resolucion de sancion" de la ONU. Para colmo, dice que "no cesa la grave violacion de derechos humanos" y "el problema de DDHH del Norte de Corea debe ser un tema de debate internacional".
					
					Este acto verbal es una artimana barata para ocupar el sillon presidencial del Sur de Corea adulando a Estados Unidos y la banda de Park Geun-hye cuando termine su mandato.
					
					Ban es lacayo proyanqui de primera categoria que detesta el pueblo surcoreano.
					
					Desde que debuto en el circulo politico sirviendo a EE.UU., el vino dedicandose al servilismo proyanqui y la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Cuando era ministro de Asuntos Exteriores y Comercio del Sur de Corea, empeoro las relaciones intercoreanas repitiendo la teoria de la "renuncia nuclear primero" de Bush e insistio en el envio de efectivos surcoreanos a Irak. Por su diplomacia a favor de EE.UU., el fue calificado como "diplomatico estadounidense".
					
					Despues de ser elegido como secretario general de la ONU bajo el control de su amo, abuso del escenario internacional como campo de confrontacion fratricida sumandose a la campana de sancion anti-RPDC y las intrigas de DDHH de EE.UU. y la banda de Park.
					
					No es casual que durante el decenio de mandato de Ban, la ONU se haya hecho aparato internacional mas incapaz, impotente y corrupto en que se predominan la arbitrariedad y el despotismo de EE.UU. y sus fuerzas seguidoras y se legalizan la agresion y la injusticia contra los paises debiles y pequenos.
					
					Es una verguenza de la nacion que ese vendepatria actue libremente en la arena internacional sin hacer cosas provechosas para los compatriotas.
					
					Estaria muy equivocado Ban, denunciado por la nacion como traidor y fanatico elemento conflictivo anti-RPDC, si el piensa que puede tomar el sillon "presidencial" con la ayuda de EE.UU. y aduloneria a Park.
					
					Mientras repercute en toda la extension surcoreana el clamor de los habitantes de distintos estratos que demandan enjuiciar y destituir a Park Geun-hye, hasta los colaboradores cercanos de ella en Chongwadae y el "Partido Saenuri" se precipitan a salir del "barco de Park Geun-hye" para salvarse.
					
					 Esto es la realidad surcoreana de ahora.
					
					 Aferrarse a Park cuya vida se esta apagando es una tonteria como subir al barco en pleno hundimiento.
					
					  La opinion publica del Sur de Corea ya condeno a muerte a Ban Ki-moon cuya popularidad cae en picada.
					
					  El debe tener presente que si sigue actuando como ahora, no podra volver al Sur de Corea ni en calidad de ciudadano comun, lejos de "presidente".
					
					  Ni el perro del campo le dara bienvenida. 
					
					  Escrito por el periodista Ryang Phil.
